rows.book_level: This is a Level 2 book for children who recognize familiar words and can read new words with help.

rows.title: Who Took My Shoe?

description.eng: Jabulani has lost his school shoe. He can’t find it anywhere. Where can it be?

text_1.eng: "Come, Jabulani," Ma says."Why aren’t you ready? You’ll be late for school." "I can’t find my shoe," says Jabulani.

text_2_left.eng: "Did you look under your bed?" says Ma. "It’s not under my bed," Jabulani says.

text_2_right.eng: "Did you look in the wardrobe?" Ma asks. "Yes, it’s not in the wardrobe."

text_3_left.eng: "I know where your shoe is," giggles Jabulani’s sister Lungi. "Where?" Jabulani asks. "I’m not telling you!" says Lungi

text_4_left.eng: "Why would someone take one shoe when they’ve got two feet?" says Lungi.

text_4_right.eng: "I don’t know. Maybe they’ve hidden it to make me cross."

text_5_left.eng: "Did you take my shoe?" he asks Lungi.

text_5_right.eng: "No," says Lungi, "your shoes are too big for me."

text_6_left.eng: "Did you take my shoe?" Jabulani asks Fruit Juice the Dog.

text_6_right.eng: She smiles her big dog smile at him and wags her tail.

text_7.eng: "Maybe a bird picked it up and flew away with your shoe," laughs Lungi.

text_8.eng: "Maybe a monkey took it and left it up in a tree, " says Jabulani.

text_9.eng: "Don’t worry, we’ll find your shoe," says Ma. "Everyone look for Jabulani’s shoe." But the shoe is nowhere to be found.

text_10.eng: "It’s all right," says Ma. "You can wear your takkies to school today."

text_11.eng: Lungi comes rushing into the kitchen with a big smile on her face. "I know where your shoe is," she shouts. "Come and see."

rows.description: Jabulani has lost his school shoe. He can’t find it anywhere. Where can it be?
rows.text_1: "Come, Jabulani," Ma says."Why aren’t you ready? You’ll be late for school." "I can’t find my shoe," says Jabulani.

rows.text_2_right: "Did you look in the wardrobe?" Ma asks. "Yes, it’s not in the wardrobe."
rows.text_3_left: "I know where your shoe is," giggles Jabulani’s sister Lungi. "Where?" Jabulani asks. "I’m not telling you!" says Lungi
rows.text_4_left: "Why would someone take one shoe when they’ve got two feet?" says Lungi.
rows.text_4_right: "I don’t know. Maybe they’ve hidden it to make me cross."
